title: NEAT-O
description:
NEAT-O: Negative Emotions and Addiction Tools for Opioid Use Disorder

Pilot Version – For Approved Study Participants Only

NEAT-O is a digital support program designed to help individuals with opioid use disorder (OUD) manage difficult emotions and build practical skills for daily life. This app is part of a research study being conducted by the University of Minnesota and is only available to participants who have enrolled in the study.

Why NEAT-O?
Designed for OUD + anxiety/depression – content targets the vicious cycle between mood and opioid use.
Evidence-informed – built on clinically tested Vicious-Cycle CBT and supported by NIDA funding.
Self-paced, mobile-first – use anytime, anywhere, no therapist required.

What you can do inside the app
Skill Modules
Learn and practise core coping skills—breathing, problem-solving, cognitive reframing, mindfulness and more—in short, interactive lessons.

Daily Wellness Tracker
Log mood, stress and craving in seconds; spot triggers with simple charts.

Personal Practice Journal
Reflect on lessons and set action plans that fit your day-to-day life.

Resource Library
Quickly reach crisis lines, MOUD info and community supports.

Favorites
Pin the lessons you rely on most for one-tap access.

Privacy & data
All information you share is encrypted, stored securely and used only for the approved study, exactly as described in your consent form.

Who should download?
Only individuals who have received an invitation link or enrolment code from the NEAT-O study team. If you have not enrolled, the app will not function.

NEAT-O is a self-guided research tool—not a medical device, therapy app or substitute for professional care. Always follow the advice of your healthcare provider.,

description:
The MEDION service app is your personal device assistant to manage all your MEDION devices (mobile phones, tablets, notebooks, PCs, home appliances and electronics) and to receive supporting information.

Key facts at a glance:
+ Safely register your MEDION devices in your account.
+ Check your MEDION device with the diagnostics function.

To perform hardware tests, the app requires shares for some components. These are for the purpose of the test only and are only initiated by the tester or not used for other activities. In addition, you can always control, revise or extend or reduce shares given in the Android settings. For a full test it is also necessary that your device is online.
Below are the backgrounds for the necessary approvals:
• Phone calls: device identification (IMEI, serial number)
• Location: GPS and network test
• Memory: read and write test
• Audio, Microphone: Audio recording and playback
• Camera, Pictures, Videos: Camera function and picture view of the test picture
• Show over other apps (Overlay): Message during the test process
• Change system settings: Brightness test

If the message appears in the Playstore: "The app may not be optimized for your device," this is due to a lack of landscape support. The functionality of the app is of course tuned to your MEDION device and deliberately designed for use in portrait format.

title: Roomba Home
description:
The Roomba® Home App is compatible with Roomba® 100, 200, 400, 500 and 700 series robots sold after March 2025. For other models, please download the iRobot Home (Classic) app.



Get ready to elevate your cleaning game with the intuitive Roomba® Home app! Easily start, stop, or schedule your robot, adjust cleaning settings, customize detailed maps of your home, and create personalized cleaning routines. Dirty rooms are noted based upon previous cleaning jobs to help you clean more effectively without having to think about it. See where and how your robot is cleaning in real-time, proactive product maintenance, and seamless smart home integrations. From setup to daily use, the Roomba® Home app offers intelligent recommendations and a user-friendly experience to keep your home spotless with minimal effort.



• Easy, Seamless Setup: Easy-to-follow onboarding guides you from unboxing to your first cleaning run with helpful tips along the way.



• Cleaning Routines: Effortlessly create cleaning routines with Routine Builder. Select which rooms to clean, adjust settings, and turn on advanced scrubbing to clean just the way you like.



• Schedules: Easily adjust the days and times your robot cleans so it runs when it’s most convenient for you.



• Cleaning Settings: Choose to vacuum, mop or both, and adjust settings like suction & mopping liquid levels, number of cleaning passes and turn on advanced scrubbing to clean each room just the way you like.



• Maps: Save up to 5 maps, label rooms, add zones and furniture for more targeted cleaning control, and start cleaning specific areas with a click.



• Real-Time Insights: See where and how your robot is cleaning and manage it along the way with real-time controls.



• Voice Control: Hands full? No need to stop what you're doing. Alexa, Siri or Google Assistant-enabled* compatibility allows you to clean with a simple command.



• Robot Maintenance & Health Dashboard: Keep your robot operating smoothly and in tip-top shape with a list of maintenance and troubleshooting suggestions, while the Health Dashboards monitors robot and accessories health.





Note: Roomba® 100 series products require a 2.4 GHz Wi-Fi® network. Not compatible with 5GHz Wi-Fi® networks.

title: Philips HomeRun Robot App
description:
Unlock the full potential of your Philips HomeRun robot. Tell it exactly how and when to clean each room and mow your lawn. Then, relax.

 

With the Philips HomeRun Robot app you can:

● Start, pause or stop cleaning and mowing remotely

● Make a precise map of your home to clean each room in no time

● Control where your robot cleans and mows

● Choose a cleaning mode per room and mowing mode per lawn

● Set up once, enjoy spotless floors and lawns daily

● Custom clean and mow for specific situations

● Get step-by-step guidance to set up easily

● Receive progress updates on each clean and mow

● Keep your data secure

 

Start, pause or stop your robot remotely

Come home to clean floors and a perfect-looking garden every day by using your Philips HomeRun vacuum, mop, and lawn mowing robot in combination with the app. Set it up once—to clean each room and mow your lawn just the way you like it—touch ‘Start’, anytime, anywhere, and let your robot do the rest.

On its first run, your robot will map your floor plan and garden. Now you have an interactive map of your home that you can use to tell your robot how and when to clean each room or to monitor how your lawn is mowed. The robot vacuum cleaner can store up to five maps.

 

Control where your robot vacuum cleaner cleans

Only want your robot to clean the kitchen, bathroom, living room? With the app, you can tell your robot which rooms you want cleaned, and in what order. If there are areas or things you’d like it to avoid—like precious items or a rug in an area you want to mop—you can tell it where not to go, or not to mop, as well.



Choose a cleaning mode for each room and mowing mode for each lawn

Give each room unique attention with one of the cleaning modes and mowing modes for your lawn. Use Dry mode to vacuum the bedroom and Wet & Dry mode to vacuum and mop hard floors. Put your robot on Quiet mode if, say, you have a meeting, or give the kitchen an extra thorough clean by using Intensive mode. Choose a mowing mode for your lawn to get the perfect looking garden.

 

Set up once. Enjoy spotless floors and lawns every day

Once you’ve created a cleaning and mowing plan, clean floors and perfectly mowed lawns are always a tap away. Tap ‘Start’ when you want your robot to begin - every day if you like, and at a time that suits your schedule.

 

Custom clean for specific situations

Had friends over and need an extra thorough clean? Or maybe the dog left paw prints in your hallway. Again. Schedule a custom clean and mow that targets specific rooms, areas.

 

Get step-by-step guidance to setup easily

From connecting to Wi-Fi to the first clean and mow, we’ll guide you through every step of getting started. You’ll find easy-to-follow instructions and how-to-videos as well.

 

Always have support at your fingertips

Have extra questions about the HomeRun app and robot? You’ll find a user manual in the app, answers to FAQs and easy access to Customer Care if need be.

 

Receive progress updates

As your robot cleans and mows, you’ll receive in-app updates. See where your robot currently is in your home and what the robot mowing progress is in your garden. Check on its battery levels and, most importantly, get notified as soon as the cleaning run or mowing is done 

 

Maintain high performance

Get the best performance from your robot by replacing parts on time. Our app lets you know when it’s time to replace parts like filters, mops, and blades, and makes it easy to order them.

 

Keep your data secure

Philips adheres to a strict privacy policy. We recommend creating an account to ensure you can save your preferences. If you prefer, you can use the app as a guest. 

 

WiFi

Philips HomeRun robot vacuum cleaners have dual band Wi-Fi so they are easy to connect to your home Wi-Fi, whether it's to 2.4 or 5.0GHz. Robot lawn mowers only connect to your 2.4GHz home Wi-Fi.

 

Need help?

Visit www.Philips.com to find answers to our most frequently asked questions, or get in touch with our Consumer Care team.

*** App permissions***
The application service requires the following permissions on your phone. For optional permissions, if they are not accessed, the related features will not be available, but it will not affect the basic using of the App.
[Required Permissions]
/

[Optional Permissions]
-Location: Used for device networking, discovering nearby devices, and obtaining WiFi information currently connected to the mobile device.
-Camera: Scan the QR code on the Robot for networking, and scan the sharing code for device sharing.
-Photos and Videos(Storage): Used for changing profile pictures, posting image comments, and online customer service providing feedback via images.
-Microphone: Audio and video call feature for customer service and Robot Video Manager.
-Bluetooth: Used for connecting devices via Bluetooth, enabling network configuration and robot controlling.
-Nearby Devices: Used for scanning and discovering nearby Bluetooth devices during network configuration.
-WLAN: Used for connecting to the Wi-Fi hotspot emitted by the device for network configuration.
-Notifications: Used for sending device and system notification messages to users.
-Local Network: Used to enable local network access on iOS devices, allowing connection to the Wi-Fi hotspot released by the device during network configuration.
-Music and audio: Audio and video call feature for customer service and Robot Video Manager.

Requirements:
Wi-Fi with 2.4 GHz or 2.4/5 GHz mixed band support only
Mobile device with Apple iOS 10.0 or later

title: MassageRobot
description:
Life hurts, so the founders designed a life-sized autonomous massage robot with collaborative robotic arms and cloud artificial intelligence. Users can control robot motion and force with their normal voice in more than 100 languages or dialects. With Machine Learning, the robot can create and recommend massage routines. In addition, users can build their own personalized routines and then share them using this intuitive mobile app.

Key Features–

-Choose routines from the following massage routine categories: For you, Activities, Ailments, Lifestyle, Sports, Target Areas, Wellness, and Workout.

-Get a recommendation from the robot’s recommendation engine.

-See routine details including tool, location, force, speed and paths.

-Create your own routine.

-Let the robot create a routine for you.

-Run a routine when you visit us for a demonstration.

Engineering --
The robot is connected to Google Cloud Platform and utilizes AI, ML, and Natural Language Processing services. Algorithms and AI enable the robot to recognize patterns of what humans prefer. It is learning what humans like. It’s already evolving. Using a Deep Learning Recommendation Engine, the robot will eventually learn to diagnose with increasing accuracy and prescribe massage routines with precision. The robot touches humans in a way that is so unique that it has to be felt to comprehend fully.

“We believe this will disrupt the global health and wellness industry for good, “stated Christian Mackin.

Collaborative Robotics -- The robot has two 6-axis collaborative robotic arms that are intrinsically safe due to mass, speed, gearing, and software limits. The robot is programmed with sophisticated algorithms and equations that process parameters from a database. Parameters such as tool-ID, location, duration, path, speed, and force describe a given routine segment. Segments can be strung together into an unlimited number of different full routines.

Sharing Massages --The robot is integrated with this mobile App. Users can intuitively create personalized massage routines and then share them publicly or privately. The robot uses a proprietary calibration process to measure each user’s body coordinates while setting up a profile. These coordinates are then used in an algorithm that enables users to share routines, so even the largest NFL football player can share with the tiniest ballerina. 

Design --
“People generally believe massage therapy relieves pain and stress and that it’s a far better alternative to prescription drugs or surgery, but it still doesn’t appeal to everyone.” Stated Christian Mackin 

WHY IS THAT? We think it’s because, among other things like economics and convenience, massage has a reputation for sexual misconduct that people don’t want to associate with. Nobody wants the jokes to be about them or worse; nobody wants to be assaulted. For people with body image issues, the last thing that will relieve their stress is a stranger rubbing the imperfections they have the most insecurities about. In everything we do, Design Thinking guides how we empathize with humans. We believe good design is both beautiful and intelligent. With deliberate and distinctive use of contemporary modern style, innovative materials such as bio-resistant coverings, and Artificial Intelligence, we aim to create forms, surfaces, and technologies that excite the senses and inspire the mind. We believe our robot can transform how people find relief from the stress and pain of life. 

Robot-as-a-Service-
After every massage it completes, the robot knows more than the last. This futuristic product is designed to be accessible by consumers today. At health and wellness centers, with a low Robot-as-a-Service (RAAS) price point, we want to enable businesses to make robotic massage accessible and affordable so it can become an integral part of everyone's wellness program.",

title: DroneMagic
description:
The DroneMagic Autonomous Flight Solution



https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCc0jPPUJCDjViXmzQxK54uA/



DroneMagic is an innovative and comprehensive autonomous drone operating application to support unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) drone missions using DJI commercial drones including the Mavic, Phantom, Inspire and Matrice series. Each flight includes tools for planning, mission-based flight, data capture and post-flight analysis.  DroneMagic is ideal for commercial implementations for roof inspections, real estate, agriculture, golf courses and more.

The software’s intuitive Android-based Google Maps interface is used to easily and quickly create single, multi-point and orthomosaic mapping mission plans. The DroneMagic App includes four (4) mission operating modes: 

1. Waypoint Missions – Designed with safe takeoff and return home features, Waypoint pilotless flights are configurable to any number of pre-selected map locations that includes named waypoints to optimize flight data for post-mission analysis. 

2. NEW Mapping Missions with post-flight orthomosaic map rendering - DroneMagic includes an innovative tool to rapidly create a mapping flight grid with pre-calculated path overlap.  Mapping missions generate high-res 2D orthomosaic maps, 3D models, thermal maps and surface elevation graphics.  Post-flight photo-based ortho processing is included.  

3. Hotpoint Missions – Hotpoint flights navigate a circumference around a pre-specified geographical target. They are automated, line of sight missions that occur within remote controller range.   

4. QuickPoint Missions – QuickPoint flights are fully autonomous for beyond visual line of sight missions that have FAA Part 107 approval.  QuickPoint allows for a single point, rapid set-up, fully autonomous Hotpoint aerial drone mission (see above) 



DroneMagic Operating Features

Google Maps interface - Visualize flight plans on Google Maps with automatic screenshot capture for each mission. A hybrid integration provides satellite view with street details to optimize waypoint placement. 

Mapping - Rapidly auto-create a mapping-mission grid overlay by touching the Google Maps interface to create a four-point boundary. DroneMagic will auto-fill the mapping route based on pre-selected flight parameters.

Safety - Drone damage and loss prevention features are standard through a safe height collision and obstacle avoidance system with an optimized safe go-home height.  DroneMagic will pre-detect a safe home location before allowing takeoff.

Battery Management - Battery sensors are auto-configured based on flight plan with ability to check drone battery lifetime left.  

Data Management - Post-mission photo data transfer includes a wireless transfer option of photos from drone to a tablet’s storage and/or a hard-wired transfer to any device with USB connectivity. Storage-ready flight logs, imagery, photos, video, and uploaded files.  Google Drive storage integration with Waypoint Missions.  

Web Integration - Auto-update a website with mission media content. System will compress photos into a web-optimized format with upload to Google Drive storage.  

Video -  A satellite-detected home waypoint is automatically set.  Stream live via YouTube (applies to LOS flights)

Ortho Processing - Export and integrate with DroneMagic mapping software to generate orthomosaics, digital surface models, NDVI maps, plant health graphics and contour maps.

title: Drone Tracker
description:
Drone Tracker is an app used for vision-based object tracking for DJI drones. The app allows you to perform visual tracking in real time using drone’s primary camera as the drone autonomously flies following the tracked object. The app allows you to view the video stream from the drone’s primary camera during the flight operation with an overlay showing the tracked object.



Drone Tracker app is used with DJI drones and requires a DJ RC controller to be connected to the device. Following DJI drones are supported:



1.	Matrice 350 RTK

2.	Matrice 300 RTK

3.	DJI Mini 3

4.	DJI Mini 3 Pro

5.	DJI Mavic 3M

6.	DJI Mavic 3 Enterprise Series

7.	Matrice 30 Series



The app was developed by DeepMAV.ai.



The app allows you to safely take off, land and return to takeoff location by using the flight control panel on the bottom.



Tracking



To perform a tracking flight, first ensure the drone is powered on and connected to the RC. Also ensure the RC is powered on and the device is connected to the RC via the USB cable. You can check if the drone connection is successful by previewing the camera video by pressing the camera button in the app.



When the camera video preview panel is visible, tap anywhere inside the camera panel to select the object to track. The app will show a white rectangle overlay over the camera preview panel. Confirm you wish to start tracking in the popup dialog and the drone will start the tracking operation.



While the drone is in tracking mode, the button in the top left corner shows Tracking On. Pressing that button allows you to stop tracking.



Tapping anywhere inside the camera preview panel again allows you to select a different object to track. You can do this even while tracking is in progress.



While tracking is on, the video preview panel shows the live drone camera video with an overlay showing the location of the tracked objects in the frame.



When the drone is tracking, after takeoff, you can enable autonomous flight by pressing the Fly button in the bottom center panel. The drone will autonomously yaw to follow the tracked object and fly towards it if the object moves further away. Stopping autonomous flight will make the drone hover in place.



Simulator Mode



Drone Tracker app allows you to test your drone flight in simulator mode. Simply start the app, turn on your drone, make sure the RC is connected to the drone, and connect the device to the RC. Pressing the Sim On/Off button switches between simulator and normal mode. When the simulator is turned on, the button will show the Sim On status.



In simulator mode, the drone will perform takeoff, landing, and return to home functions, as if it was truly flying. You can use the control sticks on the RC to fly the drone manually in simulator mode. The map will display the drone’s simulated location. All other functions of the app are enabled including video preview and tracking. Note that the video preview shows the actual live feed from the drone’s primary camera and is not simulated.



No account creation or login required. Simply start the app and start flying.



Make sure to fly responsibly and obey your local drone regulations.

title: Drone Autonomy
description:
Drone Autonomy is an app used for autonomous drone flights with DJI drones. The app supports two modes of flight autonomy. In Position mode, you can control where the drone navigates by selecting locations on the map. In Area flight mode, you can define an area on the map and the drone navigates autonomously within the defined flight boundary. Drone Autonomy allows you to live stream the video feed from the drone’s primary camera to a streaming service such as YouTube over the internet.



Drone Autonomy app is used with DJI drones and requires a DJ RC controller to be connected to the device. Following DJI drones are supported:

1.	Matrice 350 RTK

2.	Matrice 300 RTK

3.	DJI Mini 3

4.	DJI Mini 3 Pro

5.	DJI Mavic 3M

6.	DJI Mavic 3 Enterprise Series

7.	Matrice 30 Series



The app was developed by DeepMAV.ai.



Perform automatic takeoff by pressing the Take Off button in the app. Upon takeoff, you can switch on autonomous flight by pressing the Fly button in the flight control panel.



Position Autonomy Mode



When in autonomous flight in Position mode, the drone will navigate to the defined target location while maintaining the chosen altitude above takeoff. Upon reaching the target location, the drone will hover in place. Simply tap on the map to define the target location for the drone. Pressing the Clear Target button removes the defined target and makes the drone hover in place.



Area Autonomy Mode



When in Area mode, tapping on the map allows you to define the vertices of the flight area within which the drone will fly. Pressing the Save Area button saves the defined flight area and displays it on the map. Pressing the Clear Area button removes the defined flight area. You may define a flight area of any polygonal shape.



When you activate the autonomous flight in Area mode by pressing the Fly button, the drone will start flying autonomously within the defined flight area, while maintaining the chosen altitude above takeoff. The drone will never leave the bounds of the defined flight area during the flight.



Deactivating the autonomous flight by pressing the Stop button will hold the drone in place. Autonomous flight may be resumed by pressing on the Fly button once again.



Automatic landing and return to home functions may be engaged by pressing the Land and Home buttons on the flight control panel.



Live Streaming



Drone Autonomy app allows you to live stream the video feed from the drone’s primary camera to a streaming service such as YouTube. The live streaming requires that the device is connected to the internet or a network where the streaming service can be reached.



In order to live stream the drone video, first enable the camera view by pressing the Camera button. Once the camera view is visible, pressing the Live Stream button allows you to select the URL of the streaming service you wish to stream to and start the stream.



While live streaming is active, the Live Stream button will flash red. Turning off live streaming can be done by pressing the flashing Live Stream button.



Simulator Mode



Drone Autonomy app allows you to test your drone flight in simulator mode. Simply start the app, turn on your drone, make sure the RC is connected to the drone, and connect the device to the RC. Pressing the Sim On/Off button switches between simulator and normal mode. When the simulator is turned on, the button will show the Sim On status.



In simulator mode, the drone will perform takeoff, autonomous flight, landing, or return to home functions, as if it was truly flying. The map will display the drone’s simulated location. All other functions of the app are enabled including Position and Area mode and live streaming.



No account creation or login required. Simply start the app and start flying.



Make sure to fly responsibly and obey your local drone regulations.

title: SidePilot
description:
This is the app for drone enthusiasts who wish to have a more portable ground station.

Works with ArduPilot autopilot via WiFi, Bluetooth Low Energy or Cellular connection, including 3DR Solo.

NOTE: You must have either WiFi, Cellular or Serial Bluetooth connection to your drone.

User Manual is available at https://sidepilot.net

Features:
• Supports ArduCopter, ArduPlane and ArduRover via MAVLink protocol.
• Displays current drone location, with information such as altitude, yaw, pitch and roll.
• ADSB integration to display nearby aircraft and provide warnings.
• Create, edit and delete waypoints and geofences.
• Audible alerts for important information.
• Edit, save and load parameters.
• Perform a Pre-Flight checklist with live weather information.
• Low battery warnings and alerts.
• View onboard video, and live stream it to YouTube.
• Record telemetry logs and export for sharing.
• Follow Me - Have your drone follow you using your devices GPS location, or visually with Object Tracking.
• Orbit mode - Automatically orbit an object for a fantastic cinematic shots!
• Grid Waypoints - Create a survey grid to fly
• Tap to fly - Tap a location on the map to send your drone there!
• Perform calibrations at the field.
• And many, many more...

Quick-start guide (Using a WiFi connection):
1. Turn on drone and connect using WiFi.
2. Start SidePilot, navigate to settings and select either WiFi UDP, TCP or 3DR Solo (as applicable).
3. If setting up WiFi manually, click on WiFi Settings and input the correct IP address and port that the MAVLink protocol is running over.
4. Go back to the main screen and press the connect button on the top right. The app will begin displaying information about the drone. If not, double check your WiFi settings.

Please post suggestions and bug reports on the SidePilot Facebook page or via email to tom@sidepilot.net


WARNING: Continued use of GPS running in the background can dramatically decrease battery life.

Note: iPads without cellular do not have GPS capability unless tethered to a iOS Device with cellular, and even then it is poor and not suitable for navigation.
